data.title: Still Game star dead at 64 as tributes flood in for 'talented' Glasgow actor
data.meta_description: Vincent Friell rose to fame after starring in the legendary film, Restless Natives. He then went on to play Diane's father in Trainspotting before returning home for a role in the popular sitcom.
data.text:
Still Game and Trainspotting star Vincent Friell has died aged 64, his agent has confirmed.

The Glasgow-born actor rose to fame after starring in the legendary Scots film, Restless Natives. He then went on to play Diane's father in Trainspotting.

He returned home for a role in Still Game where he played Craiglang property developer Chris Howden.

READ MORE: Fundraiser launched in memory of Glasgow boxing legend Willie Limond as rival 'devastated'

READ MORE: Paisley home 'blew up in flames' as roof collapses in devastating blaze

Jane McCarry, 54, who played Isa Drennan in the hit sitcom, said: "I’m very sad to hear Vincent has passed away. He was a lovely guy. Very funny and a great actor."

Former radio presenter Ronnie McGhie shared a heartfelt tribute to the star, and said: "I'm totally shocked to hear that Scottish actor Vincent Friell has passed away.

"He was in many programmes, but it's his performance in the movie Restless Natives that he'll be remembered for. A wonderful film.

"My thoughts are with his family and friends. Vincent, you shall be missed."

Film director Carter Ferguson said: "I'm so sorry to hear that Vince Friell has passed away.

"What a lovely, funny, talented guy. He joined us on my feature film, Fast Romance. A homage in many ways to films like Restless Natives, for which he was so famous.

"What a legend."

Alex Norton, who plays Eric Baird in Two Doors Down, said: “I was sorry to hear that Vincent had died at such a young age.”

Musicians Big Country wrote: "Big Country would like to send their sincere condolences to family, friends and colleagues on the sudden passing of Vincent Friell.

Join Glasgow Live's WhatsApp community here and get the latest news sent straight to your messages.

"A brilliant Scottish actor who played many roles . Vincent was probably best known for his portrayal as lead actor Will Bryce in the movie Restless Natives, released in 1985. The sound track that helped put Big Country firmly on the map.

"RIP Vincent."
